TopicTitle: How to take screenshots on MacOs ?

Articles.Content:
Hello,

I can\'t take screen-shot with the F1 touch, because it change brightness, so I use the cmd+shift+3 combination of MacOs, but the shift key makes my engine accelerate, not very handy.

Any solution ? (I always could change the shift key for throttle up, but I like it like this).

Thanks.

You can always change the key used for screenshots on the key bindings screen in options.

EDIT: Well dang, that doesn\'t seem to be a changeable option on the control mapping screen.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
alt - f1 is the f1 function. You have all the function keys that everyone else has, you just have to use the alt key.

On a Macbook it\'s Fn+F1, no alt key.

You will also have to change the key bindings for zoom in/out to avoid using the SHIFT key: I use - (minus) and = (equals).

For video capture on a Mac I use IShowU HD, but it\'s a bit of a resource hog and competes with KSP. I\'d be interested to learn what other Mac owners are using to make Youtube videos of their KSP flights.
